page.title: 11Energy
page.content: In the 1970's a pipeline was put down to carry oil from the Amlwch Off Shore terminal to Stanlow in Cheshire. This is known as the Shell U.K. pipeline. A section of it has been put underground in the area. The path is marked at intervals by white standpipes and this enables the path to be traced from the air. It crosses the land in a west to east direction and all farmers have been compensated for the use of their land. The area is also crossed by electricity pylons. There are two types. One type carries very high voltage electricity for the National Grid from power stations like Wylfa and Trawsfynnydd.Smaller pylons carry lower voltage power to supply local properties. The pylons take up considerable land and land owners have again been compensated.
